creator: carl@voodoomedia.co.uk
text:
I see a lot of these in my event log, after about 2 days it gets to the stage 
where the event log is full and apache dies and requires a machine reboot.

It's on a Windows 2000 SP3 machine running Apache 1.3.7 with PHP4.3.1 
installed.

i'm not sure what sparks it off, they just seem to "appear" now and then, I 
cannot replicate a particular page which causes it either.


Event Type:	Error
Event Source:	COM+
Event Category:	SVC
Event ID:	4194
Date:		19/03/2003
Time:		14:09:21
User:		N/A
Computer:	NUSWEB1
Description:
The system has called a custom component and that component has failed and 
generated an exception. This indicates a problem with the custom component. 
Notify the developer of this component that a failure has occurred and provide 
them with the information below. 
Component Prog ID: SC.Pool 0 0
Method Name: IDispenserDriver::CreateResource
Process Name: Apache.exe
The serious nature of this error has caused the process to terminate.
Exception: C0000005
Address: 0x753807DC
Call Stack: 
sqloledb + 0x107DC
sqloledb + 0x5680
oledb32!DllGetClassObject + 0x1919
COMSVCS!DispManGetContext(unsigned long *,unsigned long *) + 0xB27
COMSVCS!DispManGetContext(unsigned long *,unsigned long *) + 0x163F
 + 0x541BE30
 + 0x99E5C4B7

creator: wrowe@apache.org
text:
This report has nothing to do with Apache - perhaps a problem in PHP
  but I doubt this too.
